meanings.definition: A colorless, oily, water-soluble liquid, C5H4N4, that is obtained from tobacco and related plants and is used as an insecticide.
meanings.sent1: The farmer sprayed nicotins on the crops to protect them from pests.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the effects of nicotins on insects to develop safer insecticides.
meanings.sent3: The bugs at the picnic were so scared of nicotins that they ran away!
meanings.sent4: The nicotins acted like a shield, keeping the plants safe from harmful bugs.
meanings.sent5: In the garden, the nicotins sparkled like a protective barrier around the plants.

meanings.definition: A toxic, addictive substance found in tobacco products.
meanings.sent1: Many people struggle to quit smoking due to the addictive nature of nicotins.
meanings.sent2: Health warnings highlight the dangers of nicotins in cigarettes.
meanings.sent3: The cat coughed when it accidentally inhaled the smoke containing nicotins.
meanings.sent4: Nicotins can be like a sneaky thief, stealing away your health without you realizing.
meanings.sent5: The smell of nicotins lingered in the air, a constant reminder of the addiction.
